com.milk.objed
Class BaseWrappedValueEditor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.objed.BaseWrappedValueEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Editable, Editor, ValueEditor
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckboxEditor, TextEditor
public abstract class BaseWrappedValueEditor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ValueEditor, Editable

This is a base class which implements ValueEditor to defer to some other target editor. Among other things, it provides call-backs for when events get fired from the target. Also, it implements the Editable interface to refer to itself, as opposed to creating an editor for the innards of the object itself. By default, most of the Editor methods just defer to the target, except for {add,remove}Listener(), which operate locally to make the events work out right. The ValueEditor methods may be overridden to do special processing on the value.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

private  class BaseWrappedValueEditor.TargetListener
          This class is used as a listener on the target, in order to cause events that it sends out to be sent out from this (outer) object too.

getValue

public java.lang.Object getValue()
Get the current value from this editor. This implementation just defers to the target, but subclasses may override this to do interesting processing (and should use super.getValue() to actually get the underlying value from the target).

Specified by:
getValue in interface ValueEditor
Returns:
the current value
Throws:
BadValueException - thrown if the value is bad in some way

getLabel

public final java.lang.String getLabel()
Get a short human-oriented label/description for the object this editor is editing. The label should be suitable as a label next to this editor, and shouldn't ever change during the lifetime of this editor.

Specified by:
getLabel in interface Editor
Returns:
the label

getDescription

public final java.lang.String getDescription()
Get a full human-oriented description for the object this editor is editing. The description should be suitable for tip-text or the like. It's okay for the description to change, and if it does, a descriptionChanged event will be sent to any registered listeners.

Specified by:
getDescription in interface Editor
Returns:
the full description

isMutable

public final boolean isMutable()
Return true if this editor is mutable. That is, if this method returns true, then edits can actually happen on this object. If false, this object is for display only. If the mutability of this object changes, a mutabilityChanged event will be sent to any registered listeners.

Specified by:
isMutable in interface Editor
Returns:
true if this editor is mutable

update

public final void update()
Ask this editor to update its internal state. In this case, it merely passes the request to the target editor.

Specified by:
update in interface Editor

getEditor

public final Editor getEditor()
Get an Editor for this object. In this case, it returns this.
